body:
While following the [petset example](http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/petset/):

``` console
$ kubectl describe petsets
Name:           web
Namespace:      default
Image(s):       gcr.io/google_containers/nginx-slim:0.7
Selector:       app=nginx
Labels:         app=nginx
Replicas:       2 current / 2 desired
Annotations:        <none>
CreationTimestamp:  Mon, 11 Jul 2016 11:20:05 -0700
Pods Status:        2 Running / 0 Waiting / 0 Succeeded / 0 Failed
No volumes.
Events:
  FirstSeen LastSeen    Count   From        SubobjectPath   Type        Reason          Message
  --------- --------    -----   ----        -------------   --------    ------          -------
  1m        1m      1   {petset }           Warning     FailedCreate        pvc: www-web-0, error: persistentvolumeclaims "www-web-0" not found
  1m        1m      1   {petset }           Normal      SuccessfulCreate    pet: web-0
  1m        1m      1   {petset }           Warning     FailedCreate        pvc: www-web-1, error: persistentvolumeclaims "www-web-1" not found
  33s       33s     1   {petset }           Normal      SuccessfulCreate    pet: web-1
```

Questions:
- Should FailedCreate be a Warning if it typically happens and then later gets automatically resolved?
- Should the petset controller wait for PVC dynamic provisioning before sending a create pods?
- Should the petset controlelr send a FailedCreate event if the failure is expected?
